name: Italian Meatballs
description: Mamma mia, we’ve got meatballs! These are so easy, they practically cook themselves. Yet, they give off that fancy, “I spent hours in the kitchen” vibe. And, they’re gluten free, low sodium, and kid friendly—all the good stuff. These meatballs are great for meal prep: freeze the extras for a hassle-free dinner later. Use ‘em in pasta dishes, pizzas, sammies, soups, stir-fries, and more, or serve them on their own for a happy appy. Mangia!
preparation: Preheat oven to 400° F. Line Sheet Pan with Sheet Pan Liner.
In a large bowl, combine seasoning with beef, pork, eggs, milk, and Parmesan cheese, if using.
Moisten hands with water and form mixture into 32 meatballs, about 2 tbsp each. Arrange on pan.
Bake 15–18 min, or until cooked through.
tips: For a vegetarian option, swap 2 lbs eggplant for ground meat. Dice eggplant into small cubes. Place in Multipurpose Steamer. Cover; microwave on high 5–7 min, or until tender. Lightly mash. Stir in 2 eggs, seasoning, and 1⁄4 cup Parmesan cheese (optional). Form into meatballs and continue with recipe directions above.
perfectlyBalanceYourPlate: Serve 4 meatballs with 1⁄2 cup rice or pasta, and 2 cups leafy greens with 1 tbsp Epicure Dressing.
